ygData.subject: Re: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs
ygData.msgSnippet: ROFLMAO ... From: Nygaardr, FC3  To:  Sent: Friday, January 26, 2001 5:15 PM Subject: RE: [EQ-Quest] EQ
ygData.messageBody:
ROFLMAO

----- Original Message -----
From: "Nygaardr, FC3" <nygaardr@...>
To: <EQ-Quest@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 26, 2001 5:15 PM
Subject: RE: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs


>
> Try it without fighting anything, just type /ex , you will see what I
mean.
>
> Hint (/exit /quit) same thing.
>
> Mu =P
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mycaell [mailto:mycaell@...]
> Sent: Friday, January 26, 2001 7:31 PM
> To: EQ-Quest@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs
>
>
> Mu, you have a very funny sense of humor. The computer will kill the mob
> for you......?<grin> That would truly be funny if you could watch
> everyone find the fiercest MOB they can, fight to 1/3 health and then
> frantically type /ex and expect it to work. Then realize what has
happened
> and make a desparate attempt to run. <smile> Warped is what most folks
> would call your line of humor, extremely warped. <grin>
>
> Mycael, who usually falls for these weird ways to learn experience.
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Nygaardr, FC3" <nygaardr@...>
> To: <EQ-Quest@egroups.com>
> Sent: Thursday, January 25, 2001 5:31 PM
> Subject: RE: [EQ-Quest] EQ bugs
>
>
> > Target a mob that is red to you and start to try and kill it. When you
> are
> > at about 1/3 health type /ex (stands for experience) and the computer
will
> > kill the mob for you, just make sure your at 1/3 or less life and also
> that
> > the mob is a deep red. Its really fast exp.
> >
> > Mu
